label: Behavior 37233994
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route forms a small elliptical pattern, approximated by a parametric equation of a circle with radius ~20 meters: lat(t) ≈ 55.0415 + 0.0001 × sin(2πt), lon(t) ≈ 9.4292 + 0.00007 × cos(2πt), where t ∈ [0,1] represents normalized time over the loop; this reflects the vessel turning in place or adjusting position within a confined harbor area, likely during docking preparation or anchoring
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a low and consistent speed between 0.2 and 0.8 knots, indicating controlled maneuvering)
Course change: fluctuating (the COG changes significantly from 32° to 330°, then back to 50°, showing a pronounced U-turn pattern)
Heading fluctuation: gradual and consistent (the heading steadily increases from 82° to 115°, then decreases slightly, reflecting smooth rudder adjustments during the turn)
